01982   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(var, &numData, &numComp, &assoc, 
01983                  &mathtype, &datatype);
01984   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01985     return rc;
01986 
01987   // check that variables and const are similar enough
01988   if (numComp != constNumComp) {
01989     fc_printfErrorMessage("Variables and const do not have the same numComp");
01990     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01991   }
01992 
01993   // check that the datatype can be handled here
01994   if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT && 
01995       datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE) {
01996     fc_printfErrorMessage("datatype '%s' cannot be handled",
01997                  fc_getDataTypeText(datatype));
01998     return FC_ERROR;
01999   }
02000 
02001   // get data
02002   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(var, &data);
02003   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02004     return rc;
02005 
02006   // calc values
02007   dblResultPtr = malloc(sizeof(double)*numData*numComp);
02008   if (dblResultPtr == NULL) {
02009     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02010     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;   
02011   }
02012   if (datatype == FC_DT_INT) {
02013     int* cast_data = (int*)data;
02014     for (i = 0; i < numData; i++)
02015       for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
02016      dblResultPtr[i*numComp+j] = (*binaryFunction)(constValues[j], 
02017                                   cast_data[i*numComp+j]);
02018   }
02019   else if (datatype == FC_DT_FLOAT) {
02020     float* cast_data = (float*)data;
02021     for (i = 0; i < numData; i++)
02022       for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
02023      dblResultPtr[i*numComp+j] = (*binaryFunction)(constValues[j], 
02024                                   cast_data[i*numComp+j]);
02025   }
02026   else if (datatype == FC_DT_DOUBLE) {
02027     double* cast_data = (double*)data;
02028     for (i = 0; i < numData; i++)
02029       for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
02030      dblResultPtr[i*numComp+j] = (*binaryFunction)(constValues[j], 
02031                                   cast_data[i*numComp+j]);
02032   }
02033   else {
02034     fc_printfErrorMessage("Should never reach here, error in code!\n");
02035     return FC_ERROR;
02036   }
02037 
02038   // create the new variable
02039   if (fc_isVariableGlobal(var)) {
02040     FC_Dataset dataset;
02041     rc = fc_getDatasetFromVariable(var, &dataset);
02042     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02043       return rc;
02044     rc = fc_createGlobalVariable(dataset, new_var_name, new_var);
02045     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02046       return rc; 
02047   }
02048   else {
02049     FC_Mesh mesh;
02050     rc = fc_getMeshFromVariable(var, &mesh);
02051     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02052       return rc;
02053     rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, new_var_name, new_var);
02054     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02055       return rc; 
02056   }
02057   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*new_var, numData, numComp, assoc, mathtype, 
02058                     FC_DT_DOUBLE, dblResultPtr);
02059   return rc;
02060 }
02061 
02062 //@}
02063 
02064 /** \name User functions on sequence variables. */
02065 //-------------------------------
02066 //@{
02067 
02068 /**
02069  * \ingroup  VariableMath
02070  * \brief Performs unary function on a seq variable.
02071  *
02072  * \description  
02073  *
02074  *    Given a unary function that takes a double and returns a double, this
02075  *    function creates a new seq variable whose values are the results of the
02076  *    function applied to the original seq variable's values. This is the
02077  *    seqvar analogy of fc_varUnaryFunction
02078  *
02079  *    The new seq variable will be on the same mesh and sequence as the original
02080  *    and will have the same association and math type as the original. 
02081  *    The function is performed on each component of each data point at each sequence
02082  *    step. The new variable will
02083  *    always have data type FC_DT_DOUBLE. This function returns with an error
02084  *    if the data is FC_DT_CHAR.
02085  *
02086  *   NOTE: this uses createSeqVariable so user will have to deleteSeqVariable 
02087  *   *and* free it unless deleteseqvar is changed.
02088  *
02089  * \modifications 
02090  *    - 06/07/05  ACG  Created.
02091  *    - 06/07/05  ACG removing datatype check and leaving that to internal call
02092  *    - 01/24/06  WSK Rewrote innards to mimimize data creation.
02093  */  
02094 FC_ReturnCode fc_seqVarUnaryFunction(
02095   int numStep, /**< input - num step in input seq var */
02096   FC_Variable *seq_var, /**< input seq var */
02097   double (*unaryFunction)(double),
02098                         /**< input - function that operates on a double
02099                 and returns a double */     
02100   char* new_seq_var_name,   /**< input - name for the new variable */ 
02101   FC_Variable** new_seq_var  /**< output - the new seq variable */
02102 ) {
02103   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02104   FC_Sequence seq;
02105   FC_Variable* temp_vars;
02106   int i, j;
02107   
02108   // check input
02109   if (new_seq_var)
02110     *new_seq_var = NULL;
02111 
02112   // check input
02113   if ((!fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep,seq_var)) || (new_seq_var == NULL)
02114       || new_seq_var_name == NULL){
02115     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02116     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02117   }
02118   //other checks are done internally in varUnaryFunction (incl numerical type),
02119 
02120   // log message
02121   fc_printfLogMessage("Performing UnaryFunctionSeqVar on seq variable '%s'",
02122                 _fc_getVarSlot(seq_var[0])->header.name);
02123 
02124   // Get info
02125   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep,seq_var,&seq);
02126   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02127     return rc;
02128 
02129   // Make space to save temp_vars
02130   temp_vars = malloc(numStep*sizeof(FC_Variable));
02131   if (!temp_vars) {
02132     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02133     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02134   }
02135   
02136   // Do calculation on each step of the seq variables
02137   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
02138     rc = fc_varUnaryFunction(seq_var[i],unaryFunction, "junk_var", &temp_vars[i]);
02139     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
02140       for (j = 0; j < i-1; j++)
02141      fc_deleteVariable(temp_vars[j]);
02142       free(temp_vars);
02143       fc_printfErrorMessage("Operation failed on step %d", i);
02144       return rc;
02145     }
02146   }
02147 
02148   // stitch steps into the new seq var
02149   rc = fc_convertVariablesToSeqVariable(numStep, temp_vars, seq,
02150                          new_seq_var_name, new_seq_var);
02151   free(temp_vars);
02152   return rc;
02153 }
02154 
02155 /**
02156  * \ingroup  VariableMath
02157  * \brief Performs binary function on two seq variables.
02158  *
02159  * \description
02160  *
02161  *    Given a binary function that takes two doubles and returns a double, this
02162  *    function creates a newseq  variable whose values are the results of the
02163  *    function applied to the original seq variables' values. This is the
02164  *    seq var version of varBinaryFunctionVarVar.
02165  *
02166  *    The two variables must have the same number of data points and the same
02167  *    number of components and be on the same sequence.
02168  *
02169  *    The new variable will be on the same mesh and sequence and will have the same
02170  *    association and math type as the first variable. The function is applied
02171  *    per component and data point. The new variable will always have data type
02172  *    FC_DT_DOUBLE. This function returns with an error if the data is
02173  *    FC_DT_CHAR.
02174  *
02175  * \modifications 
02176  *    - 06/07/05  ACG  Created.
02177  *    - 01/24/06  WSK Rewrote innards to mimimize data creation.
02178  */  
02179 FC_ReturnCode fc_seqVarBinaryFunctionSeqVarSeqVar(
02180   int numStep, /**< input - num step in input seq var */
02181   FC_Variable *seq_var1, /**< input seq var1 */
02182   FC_Variable *seq_var2, /**< input seq var2 */
02183   double (*binaryFunction)(double ddata1, double ddata2),
02184                         /**< input - function that operates on two doubles
02185                   and returns a double */
02186   char* new_seq_var_name,   /**< input - name for the new variable */ 
02187   FC_Variable** new_seq_var  /**< output - the new seq variable */
02188 ){
02189   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02190   FC_Sequence seq1, seq2;
02191   FC_Variable* temp_vars;
02192   int i, j;
02193 
02194   // default return
02195   if (new_seq_var)
02196     *new_seq_var = NULL;
02197 
02198   // check input (this indirectly checks that numStep is the same on both seqs
02199   if ((!fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep,seq_var1)) ||
02200       (!fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep,seq_var2)) ||
02201       (new_seq_var == NULL) || new_seq_var_name == NULL){
02202     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02203     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02204   }
02205   //other checks are done internally in varoperatorvar
02206 
02207   // log message
02208   fc_printfLogMessage("Performing SeqVarBinaryFunctionSeqVarSeqVar on"
02209                 "seq variables '%s' and  '%s'",
02210                 _fc_getVarSlot(seq_var1[0])->header.name,
02211                 _fc_getVarSlot(seq_var2[0])->header.name);
02212 
02213 
02214 
02215   // get info
02216   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep,seq_var1,&seq1);
02217   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02218     return rc;
02219   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep,seq_var2,&seq2);
02220   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02221     return rc;
02222   // FIX? remove this?
02223   if (!(FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(seq1,seq2))){
02224     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", "Variables are not on the same sequence");
02225     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02226   }
02227  
02228   // Make space to save temp_vars
02229   temp_vars = malloc(numStep*sizeof(FC_Variable));
02230   if (!temp_vars) {
02231     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02232     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02233   }
02234 
02235   // Do calculation on each step of the seq variables
02236   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
02237     rc = fc_varBinaryFunctionVarVar(seq_var1[i], seq_var2[i], binaryFunction,
02238                         "junk_var", &temp_vars[i]); 
02239     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) { 
02240       for (j = 0; j < i-1; j++)
02241      fc_deleteVariable(temp_vars[j]);
02242       free(temp_vars);
02243       fc_printfErrorMessage("Operation failed on step %d", i);
02244       return rc;
02245     }
02246   }
02247 
02248   // stitch steps into the new seq var
02249   rc = fc_convertVariablesToSeqVariable(numStep, temp_vars, seq1,
02250                          new_seq_var_name, new_seq_var);
02251   free(temp_vars);
02252   return rc;
02253 }
02254 
02255 //@}
02256 
02257 
02258 /** \name User functions on sequence variables. */
02259 //-------------------------------
02260 /**
02261  * \ingroup  VariableMath
02262  * \brief Performs binary function on a seqVar and seqConstant.
02263  *
02264  * \description
02265  *
02266  *    Given a binary function that takes two doubles and returns a double, this
02267  *    function creates a new sequence variable whose values are the results of the
02268  *    function applied to each value and component of the input sequence variable
02269  *    and the input sequence constant. This is the sequence variable version of 
02270  *    the varBinaryFunctionVarConst.
02271  *
02272  *    The seqVariable and seqConstant must have the same number of components, as
02273  *    well as the same number of steps.
02274  *
02275  *    The new variable will be on the same mesh and sequence and will have the same
02276  *    association and math type as the sequence variable. The function is applied
02277  *    per component and data point. The new variable will always have data type
02278  *    FC_DT_DOUBLE. This function returns with an error if the data is
02279  *    FC_DT_CHAR. 
02280  *
02281  * \modifications 
02282  *    - 03/01/2007 CDU Created
02283  */  
02284 FC_ReturnCode fc_seqVarBinaryFunctionSeqVarSeqConst(
02285   int          numStep,       /**< input  - num step in input seq var */
02286   FC_Variable *seq_var,       /**< input  - seq var1 */
02287   int          constNumComp,  /**< input  - number of components in constant*/
02288   void*        constVectors,  /**< input  - constant vectors, stored as vector for
02289                                             first step, then vector for next step, etc. */
02290   FC_DataType  constType,     /**< input  - data type of constVector */
02291 
02292   double (*binaryFunction)(double ddata1, double ddata2),
02293                               /**< input  - function that operates on two doubles
02294                                    and returns a double */
02295   char* new_seq_var_name,     /**< input  - name for the new variable */ 
02296   FC_Variable** new_seq_var   /**< output - the new seq variable */
02297 ){
02298   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02299   FC_Sequence seq;
02300   FC_Variable* temp_vars;
02301   double *temp_const;
02302   int i, j;
02303 
02304   // default return
02305   if (new_seq_var)
02306     *new_seq_var = NULL;
02307 
02308   // check input (this indirectly checks that numStep is the same on both seqs
02309   if ((!fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep,seq_var)) ||
02310       (constNumComp < 1) || (constVectors==NULL)  || 
02311       (!fc_isDataTypeValid(constType)) || (constType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN) ||
02312       (new_seq_var == NULL) || new_seq_var_name == NULL){
02313     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02314     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02315   }
02316   //other checks are done internally in varoperatorvar
02317 
02318   // log message
02319   fc_printfLogMessage("Performing SeqVarBinaryFunctionSeqVarSeqConst on"
02320                 "seq variable '%s' and a constant",
02321                 _fc_getVarSlot(seq_var[0])->header.name);
02322 
02323   // get info
02324   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep,seq_var,&seq);
02325   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02326     return rc;
02327  
02328   // Make space to save temp_vars
02329   temp_vars = malloc(numStep*sizeof(FC_Variable));
02330   if (!temp_vars) {
02331     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02332     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02333   }
02334 
02335   // Convert the constant to double
02336   temp_const = malloc(constNumComp * sizeof(double));  
02337   if(!temp_const){
02338     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02339     free(temp_vars);
02340     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02341   }
02342 
02343   // Do calculation on each step of the seq variables
02344   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
02345 
02346     //Convert this step of the constVector
02347     for(j=0;j<constNumComp;j++){
02348       switch(constType){
02349       case FC_DT_CHAR:
02350      temp_const[j] = (double) ((char  *)constVectors)[i*constNumComp+j]; break;
02351       case  FC_DT_INT: 
02352      temp_const[j] = (double) ((int   *)constVectors)[i*constNumComp+j]; break;
02353       case FC_DT_FLOAT:
02354      temp_const[j] = (double) ((float *)constVectors)[i*constNumComp+j]; break;
02355       case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
02356      temp_const[j] = (double) ((double*)constVectors)[i*constNumComp+j]; break;
02357       case FC_DT_UNKNOWN:
02358      fc_printfErrorMessage("should never get here");
02359      return FC_ERROR;
02360       }
02361     }
02362 
02363     //Make the actual call
02364     rc = fc_varBinaryFunctionVarConst(seq_var[i], 
02365                           constNumComp, temp_const,
02366                           binaryFunction,
02367                           "junk_var", &temp_vars[i]); 
02368     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
02369       for (j = 0; j < i-1; j++)
02370      fc_deleteVariable(temp_vars[j]);
02371       free(temp_const);
02372       free(temp_vars);
02373       fc_printfErrorMessage("Operation failed on step %d", i);
02374       return rc;
02375     }
02376   }
02377     
02378   free(temp_const);
02379 
02380   // stitch steps into the new seq var
02381   rc = fc_convertVariablesToSeqVariable(numStep, temp_vars, seq,
02382                          new_seq_var_name, new_seq_var);
02383   free(temp_vars);
02384   return rc;
02385 }
02386 //@}
02387 
02388 /** \name User functions on sequence variables. */
02389 //-------------------------------
02390 /**
02391  * \ingroup  VariableMath

02394  * \description
02395  *

02418                                    first step, then vector for next step, etc. */

02421

02423                               /**< input - function that operates on two doubles
02424                          and returns a double */

02427 ){

02431   double *temp_const;
02432   int i, j;
02433

02436     *new_seq_var = NULL;
02437

02439   if ((!fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep,seq_var)) ||
02440       (constNumComp < 1) || (constVectors==NULL)  ||

02444     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02445   }

02451                 _fc_getVarSlot(seq_var[0])->header.name);
02452

02455   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02456     return rc;
02457

02460   if (!temp_vars) {

02462     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02463   }
02464 
02465   // Convert the constant to double
02466   temp_const = malloc(constNumComp * sizeof(double));  
02467   if(!temp_const){
02468     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02469     free(temp_vars);
02470     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02471   }
02472 
02473 
02474   // Do calculation on each step of the seq variables
02475   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
02476 
02477     //Convert this step of the constVector
02478     for(j=0;j<constNumComp;j++){

02483      temp_const[j] = (double) ((int   *)constVectors)[i*constNumComp+j]; break;
02484       case FC_DT_FLOAT:
02485      temp_const[j] = (double) ((float *)constVectors)[i*constNumComp+j]; break;
02486       case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
02487      temp_const[j] = (double) ((double*)constVectors)[i*constNumComp+j]; break;
02488       case FC_DT_UNKNOWN:
02489      fc_printfErrorMessage("should never get here");
02490      return FC_ERROR;
02491       }
02492     }
02493 
02494     //Make the actual call
02495     rc = fc_varBinaryFunctionConstVar(constNumComp, temp_const,
02496                           seq_var[i], 
02497                           binaryFunction,
02498                           "junk_var", &temp_vars[i]); 
02499     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
02500       for (j = 0; j < i-1; j++)
02501      fc_deleteVariable(temp_vars[j]);
02502       free(temp_const);
02503       free(temp_vars);
02504       fc_printfErrorMessage("Operation failed on step %d", i);
02505       return rc;
02506     }
02507   }
02508     
02509   free(temp_const);
02510 
02511   // stitch steps into the new seq var
02512   rc = fc_convertVariablesToSeqVariable(numStep, temp_vars, seq,
02513                          new_seq_var_name, new_seq_var);
02514   free(temp_vars);
02515   return rc;
02516 }

02709 
02710 /** \name User functions between variables and sequence variables. */
02711 //-------------------------------
02712 //@{
02713 
02714 /**
02715  * \ingroup  VariableMath
02716  * \brief Performs binary function on a seq variable and a var.
02717  *
02718  * \description
02719  *
02720  *    Given a binary function that takes two doubles and returns a double, this
02721  *    function creates a newseq variable whose values are the results of the
02722  *    function applied to the original seq variable and a normal variable's
02723  *    values. 
02724  *
02725  *    The two variables must have the same number of data points and the same
02726  *    number of components.
02727  *
02728  *    The new variable will be on the same mesh and sequence and
02729  *    will have the same
02730  *    association and math type as the first variable. The function is applied
02731  *    per component and data point. The new variable will always have data type
02732  *    FC_DT_DOUBLE. This function returns with an error if the data is
02733  *    FC_DT_CHAR.
02734  *
02735  * \modifications 
02736  *    - 06/08/05  ACG  Created.
02737  *    - 06/09/05  ACG renamed for seqvarBFvarseqvar to seqvarBFseqvarvar
02738  *                in order to agre with naming convention that for functions
02739  *                the first identifier is the return type.
02740  *    - 01/24/06  WSK Rewrote innards to mimimize data creation.
02741  */  
02742 FC_ReturnCode fc_seqVarBinaryFunctionSeqVarVar(
02743   int numStep, /**< input - num step in input seq var */
02744   FC_Variable *seq_var1, /**< input seq var1 */
02745   FC_Variable var2, /**< input var2 */
02746   double (*binaryFunction)(double ddata1, double ddata2),
02747                         /**< input - function that operates on two doubles
02748                   and returns a double */
02749   char* new_seq_var_name,   /**< input - name for the new variable */ 
02750   FC_Variable** new_seq_var  /**< output - the new seq variable */
02751 ){
02752   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02753   FC_Sequence seq;
02754   FC_Variable* temp_vars;
02755   int i, j;
02756 
02757   // default return
02758   if (new_seq_var)
02759     *new_seq_var = NULL;
02760 
02761   // check input
02762   if ((!fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep,seq_var1)) ||
02763       (!fc_isVariableValid(var2)) ||
02764       (new_seq_var == NULL) || new_seq_var_name == NULL){
02765     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02766     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02767   }
02768   //other checks are done internally in varoperatorvar
02769 
02770   // log message
02771   fc_printfLogMessage("Performing SeqVarBinaryFunctionSeqVarVar on"
02772                 "seq variable '%s' and  variable '%s'",
02773                 _fc_getVarSlot(seq_var1[0])->header.name,
02774                 _fc_getVarSlot(var2)->header.name);
02775 
02776   //get info 
02777   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep, seq_var1, &seq);
02778   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02779     return rc;
02780 
02781   temp_vars = malloc(numStep*sizeof(FC_Variable));
02782   if (!temp_vars) {
02783     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02784     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02785   }
02786 
02787   // Do calculation on each step of the seq variables
02788   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
02789     rc = fc_varBinaryFunctionVarVar(seq_var1[i], var2, binaryFunction,
02790                         "junk_var", &temp_vars[i]); 
02791     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) { 
02792       for (j = 0; j < i-1; j++)
02793      fc_deleteVariable(temp_vars[j]);
02794       free(temp_vars);
02795       fc_printfErrorMessage("Operation failed on step %d", i);
02796       return rc;
02797     }
02798   }
02799 
02800   // stitch steps into the new seq var
02801   rc = fc_convertVariablesToSeqVariable(numStep, temp_vars, seq,
02802                          new_seq_var_name, new_seq_var);
02803   free(temp_vars);
02804   return rc;
02805 }
02806 
02807 /**
02808  * \ingroup  VariableMath
02809  * \brief Performs binary function on a seq variable and a var.
02810  *
02811  * \description
02812  *
02813  *    Given a binary function that takes two doubles and returns a double, this
02814  *    function creates a newseq variable whose values are the results of the
02815  *    function applied to the original seq variable and a normal variable's
02816  *    values. 
02817  *
02818  *    The two variables must have the same number of data points and the same
02819  *    number of components.
02820  *
02821  *    The new variable will be on the same mesh and sequence and
02822  *    will have the same
02823  *    association and math type as the first variable. The function is applied
02824  *    per component and data point. The new variable will always have data type
02825  *    FC_DT_DOUBLE. This function returns with an error if the data is
02826  *    FC_DT_CHAR.
02827  *
02828  * \modifications 
02829  *    - 06/08/05  ACG  Created.
02830  *    - 06/09/05  ACG renamed for seqvarBFvarseqvar to seqvarBFseqvarvar
02831  *                in order to agre with naming convention that for functions
02832  *                the first identifier is the return type.
02833  *    - 01/24/06  WSK Rewrote innards to mimimize data creation.
02834  */  
02835 FC_ReturnCode fc_seqVarBinaryFunctionVarSeqVar(
02836   FC_Variable var1, /**< input var1 */
02837   int numStep, /**< input - num step in input seq var */
02838   FC_Variable *seq_var2, /**< input seq var2 */
02839   double (*binaryFunction)(double ddata1, double ddata2),
02840                         /**< input - function that operates on two doubles
02841                   and returns a double */
02842   char* new_seq_var_name,   /**< input - name for the new variable */ 
02843   FC_Variable** new_seq_var  /**< output - the new seq variable */
02844 ){
02845   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02846   FC_Sequence seq;
02847   FC_Variable* temp_vars;
02848   int i, j;
02849 
02850   // default return
02851   if (new_seq_var)
02852     *new_seq_var = NULL;
02853 
02854   // check input
02855   if ((!fc_isVariableValid(var1)) ||
02856       (!fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep, seq_var2)) ||
02857       (new_seq_var == NULL) || new_seq_var_name == NULL){
02858     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02859     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02860   }
02861   //other checks are done internally in varoperatorvar
02862 
02863   // log message
02864   fc_printfLogMessage("Performing SeqVarBinaryFunctionSeqVarVar on"
02865                 "seq variable '%s' and  variable '%s'",
02866                 _fc_getVarSlot(var1)->header.name,
02867                 _fc_getVarSlot(seq_var2[0])->header.name);
02868 
02869   //get info 
02870   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep, seq_var2, &seq);
02871   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02872     return rc;
02873 
02874   temp_vars = malloc(numStep*sizeof(FC_Variable));
02875   if (!temp_vars) {
02876     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
02877     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02878   }
02879 
02880   // Do calculation on each step of the seq variables
02881   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
02882     rc = fc_varBinaryFunctionVarVar(var1, seq_var2[i], binaryFunction,
02883                         "junk_var", &temp_vars[i]); 
02884     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) { 
02885       for (j = 0; j < i-1; j++)
02886      fc_deleteVariable(temp_vars[j]);
02887       free(temp_vars);
02888       fc_printfErrorMessage("Operation failed on step %d", i);
02889       return rc;
02890     }
02891   }
02892 
02893   // stitch steps into the new seq var
02894   rc = fc_convertVariablesToSeqVariable(numStep, temp_vars, seq,
02895                          new_seq_var_name, new_seq_var);
02896   free(temp_vars);
02897   return rc;
02898 }
02899 
02900 //@}
02901 
02902 /**
02903  * \ingroup  PrivateVariableMath
02904  * \brief Helper function to do negation of int array
02905  *
02906  * \description
02907  *
02908  *    See \ref PrivateVariableMath.
02909  *
02910  * \modifications 
02911  *    - 11/09/04  WSK, created.
02912  */
02913 FC_ReturnCode _fc_negateInts(
02914   int num,         /**< input - length of array */
02915   int* data,       /**< input - input array */
02916   int* resultData  /**< input/output - array for results */
02917 ) {
02918   int i;
02919  
02920   if (!data || !resultData)
02921     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02922 
02923   for (i = 0; i < num; i++)
02924       resultData[i] = - data[i];
02925 
02926   return FC_SUCCESS;
02927 }
02928

02940 FC_ReturnCode _fc_negateDoubles(

02956 /**
02957  * \ingroup  PrivateVariableMath
02958  * \brief Helper function to do addition of int data arrays.
02959  *
02960  * \description
02961  *
02962  *    See \ref PrivateVariableMath.
02963  *
02964  * \modifications 
02965  *    - 01/29/04  R.McCoy  Created.
02966  *    - 02/20/04  changed to enable operations with "constant" arrays.
02967  *    - 11/09/04  WSK, changed to allow operations with constants in either
02968  *        position, and no longer allocates memory.
02969  */
02970 FC_ReturnCode _fc_addInts(
02971   int numComp,    /**< input - number of components in all data arrays */
02972   int numDataPoint1, /**< input - number of data points in data1 */
02973   int* data1,        /**< input - data1 array */
02974   int numDataPoint2, /**< input - number of data points in data2 */
02975   int* data2,        /**< input - data2 array */
02976   int* resultData    /**< input/output - data array for results */
02977 ) {
02978   int i, j;
02979  
02980   if (!data1 || !data2 || !resultData)
02981     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02982 
02983   if (numDataPoint1 == numDataPoint2) {
02984     for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint1*numComp; i++)
02985       resultData[i] = data1[i] + data2[i];
02986   }
02987   else if (numDataPoint1 == 1) { // 1st entry is a constant
02988     for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint2; i++)
02989       for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
02990      resultData[i*numComp+j] = data1[j] + data2[i*numComp+j];
02991   }
02992   else if (numDataPoint2 == 1) { // 2nd entry is a constant
02993     for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint1; i++)
02994       for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
02995      resultData[i*numComp+j] = data1[i*numComp+j] + data2[j]; 
02996   }
02997   else 
02998     return FC_ERROR;
02999 
03000   return FC_SUCCESS;
03001 }
03002

03022   int* data2,        /**< input - data2 array */

03024 ) {

03026

03029

03031     for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint1*numComp; i++)
03032       resultData[i] = data1[i] - data2[i];
03033   }
03034   else if (numDataPoint1 == 1) { // 1st entry is a constant
03035     for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint2; i++)
03036       for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
03037      resultData[i*numComp+j] = data1[j] - data2[i*numComp+j];
03038   }
03039   else if (numDataPoint2 == 1) { // 2nd entry is a constant
03040     for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint1; i++)
03041       for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)
03042      resultData[i*numComp+j] = data1[i*numComp+j] - data2[j]; 
03043   }
03044   else 
03045     return FC_ERROR;
03046 
03047   return FC_SUCCESS;

03079       resultData[i] = data1[i] * data2[i];
03080   }

03082     for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint2; i++)

03088       for (j = 0; j < numComp; j++)

03325   }

03331 
03332 /**
03333  * \ingroup  PrivateVariableMath
03334  * \brief Performs built-in binary operation on two data arrays.
03335  *
03336  * \description 
03337  *
03338  *   This is the core of fc_varOperatorVar(), fc_varOperatorConst(),
03339  *   and fc_constOperatorVar().
03340  *
03341  * \modifications 
03342  *    - 11/10/03  WSK, created.
03343  */
03344 FC_ReturnCode _fc_binaryOperatorCore(
03345   int numComp,        /**< input - number of components in both data arrays */
03346   int numData1,       /**< input - number of data points in data 1 */
03347   void* data1,        /**< input - data array 1 */ 
03348   FC_DataType datatype1, /**< input - type of data 1 */
03349   char* operation,    /**< input - operation string */
03350   int numData2,       /**< input - number of data points in data 2 */
03351   void* data2,        /**< input - data array 2 */ 
03352   FC_DataType datatype2, /**< input - type of data 2 */
03353   FC_Variable origVar,   /**< input - reference var */
03354   char* new_var_name, /**< input - name for the new variable */
03355   FC_Variable* new_var   /**< output - the new variable */
03356 ) {        
03357   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03358   int i;
03359   int opID, new_numData;
03360   FC_DataType new_datatype;
03361   FC_MathType mathtype;
03362   FC_AssociationType assoc;
03363   void* resultPtr;
03364   double *dblData1Ptr, *dblData2Ptr;
03365   // create array of pointers to int binary functions
03366   FC_ReturnCode (*IntBinaryOper[])(int, int, int*, int, int*, int*) = {       
03367                           _fc_addInts, 
03368                           _fc_subtractInts, 
03369                           _fc_multiplyInts, 
03370                           _fc_divideInts
03371                         };
03372   // corresponding double operation functions: 
03373   FC_ReturnCode (*DblBinaryOper[])(int, int, double*, int, double*, double*) = {
03374                           _fc_addDoubles, 
03375                           _fc_subtractDoubles, 
03376                           _fc_multiplyDoubles, 
03377                           _fc_divideDoubles
03378                         };
03379 
03380   // pick operation
03381   if (!strcmp(operation, "+")) 
03382     opID = 0;
03383   else if (!strcmp(operation, "-"))
03384     opID = 1;
03385   else if (!strcmp(operation, "*"))
03386     opID = 2;
03387   else if (!strcmp(operation, "/"))
03388     opID = 3;
03389   //else if (!strcmp(operation, "%"))
03390   //opID = 4;
03391   else {
03392     fc_printfErrorMessage("Input Error:operation %s not recognized.",
03393                  operation); 
03394     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03395   }   
03396 
03397   // no log message
03398 
03399   // check that the data types can be handled here
03400   if (datatype1 != FC_DT_INT && datatype1 != FC_DT_FLOAT && 
03401       datatype1 != FC_DT_DOUBLE) {
03402     fc_printfErrorMessage("data type 1 '%s' cannot be handled.", 
03403                  fc_getDataTypeText(datatype1));
03404     return FC_ERROR;
03405   } 
03406   if (datatype2 != FC_DT_INT && datatype2 != FC_DT_FLOAT && 
03407       datatype2 != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
03408     fc_printfErrorMessage("data type 2 '%s' cannot be handled",
03409                  fc_getDataTypeText(datatype2));
03410     return FC_ERROR;
03411   }
03412 
03413   // get variable info
03414   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(origVar, &new_numData, &numComp, &assoc, 
03415                  &mathtype, NULL);
03416   
03417   // Do the operation over arrays - results could be int or double    
03418   if (datatype1 == FC_DT_INT && datatype2 == FC_DT_INT) {
03419     new_datatype = FC_DT_INT;
03420     resultPtr = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*numComp*new_numData);
03421     if (resultPtr == NULL) {
03422       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));  
03423       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03424     }
03425     rc = (*IntBinaryOper[opID])(numComp, numData1, (int*)data1, numData2,
03426                     (int*)data2, (int*)resultPtr);
03427     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03428       return rc;
03429   }
03430   else {
03431     new_datatype = FC_DT_DOUBLE;
03432     // get double representation of data1
03433     if (datatype1 != FC_DT_DOUBLE) {
03434       dblData1Ptr = malloc(sizeof(double)*numComp*numData1);
03435       if (dblData1Ptr == NULL) {
03436         fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));  
03437         return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03438       } 
03439     } 
03440     if (datatype1 == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
03441       dblData1Ptr = (double*) data1;
03442     else if (datatype1 == FC_DT_INT) { 
03443       int* cast_data = (int*)data1;  
03444       for(i = 0; i < numComp*numData1; i++)
03445      dblData1Ptr[i] = (double)((cast_data)[i]);
03446     }
03447     else if (datatype1 == FC_DT_FLOAT) {   // data1 is float
03448       float* cast_data = (float*)data1;
03449       for(i = 0; i < numComp*numData1; i++)    
03450      dblData1Ptr[i] = (double)((cast_data)[i]);
03451     }
03452     // get double representation of data2
03453     if (datatype2 != FC_DT_DOUBLE) {
03454       dblData2Ptr = malloc(sizeof(double)*numComp*numData2);
03455       if (dblData2Ptr == NULL) {
03456         fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03457         return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03458       }
03459     }
03460     if (datatype2 == FC_DT_DOUBLE)
03461       dblData2Ptr = (double*)data2;
03462     else if (datatype2 == FC_DT_INT) {
03463       int* cast_data = (int*)data2;
03464       for(i = 0; i < numComp*numData2; i++)    
03465      dblData2Ptr[i] = (double)((cast_data)[i]);
03466     }
03467     else if (datatype2 == FC_DT_FLOAT) {
03468       float* cast_data = (float*)data2;  
03469       for(i = 0; i < numComp*numData2; i++)    
03470      dblData2Ptr[i] = (double)((cast_data)[i]);
03471     }
03472     
03473     // do it
03474     resultPtr = (int*)malloc(sizeof(double)*numComp*new_numData);
03475     if (resultPtr == NULL) {
03476       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));  
03477       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03478     }
03479     rc = (*DblBinaryOper[opID])(numComp, numData1, dblData1Ptr, numData2,
03480                     dblData2Ptr, (double*)resultPtr);
03481     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03482       return rc;
03483 
03484     // deallocate memory if it was allocated
03485     if (datatype1 != FC_DT_DOUBLE)
03486       free(dblData1Ptr);
03487     if (datatype2 != FC_DT_DOUBLE)
03488       free(dblData2Ptr);  
03489   }
03490   
03491   // create the new variable
03492   if (fc_isVariableGlobal(origVar)) {
03493     FC_Dataset dataset;
03494     rc = fc_getDatasetFromVariable(origVar, &dataset);
03495     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03496       return rc;
03497     rc = fc_createGlobalVariable(dataset, new_var_name, new_var);
03498     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03499       return rc; 
03500   }
03501   else {
03502     FC_Mesh mesh;
03503     rc = fc_getMeshFromVariable(origVar, &mesh);
03504     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03505       return rc;
03506     rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, new_var_name, new_var);
03507     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03508       return rc; 
03509   }
03510   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*new_var, new_numData, numComp, assoc, mathtype, 
03511                     new_datatype, resultPtr);
03512   return rc;    
03513 }
03514 
03515 /** \name Component aware manipulations. */
03516 //-------------------------------
03517 //@{
03518 
03519 /**
03520  * \ingroup  VariableMath
03521  * \brief Creates a new variable which is the magnitude of the current variable
03522  *    
03523  * \description
03524  *  
03525  *    Given a vector variable, this routine will create a new variable whose
03526  *    values are the magnitudes of the vector variable. Magnitudes are
03527  *    calculated as the distance from the origin to the point. This routine
03528  *    only works for vector variables with more than 1 components.
03529  *
03530  * \modifications 
03531  *    - 05/03/04 WSK, Created.
03532  */
03533 FC_ReturnCode fc_createMagnitudeVariable(
03534   FC_Variable var,      /**< input - a variable with vector data*/
03535   char* new_var_name,   /**< input - name for the new variable */
03536   FC_Variable* new_var  /**< output - the new magnitude of the variable */
03537 ) {
03538         
03539   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03540   int i, j;
03541   int numData, dim;
03542   FC_AssociationType assoc;
03543   FC_DataType datatype;
03544   FC_MathType mathtype;
03545   void *data;
03546   double *new_data;
03547 
03548   // set default return value
03549   if (new_var)
03550     *new_var = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03551 
03552   // check input
03553   if (!fc_isVariableValid(var) || !new_var_name || !new_var) {
03554     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));   
03555     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03556   }
03557 
03558   // get variable info
03559   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(var, &numData, &dim, &assoc, &mathtype, &datatype);
03560   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03561     return rc;
03562   // check the datatype that can be handled here
03563   // the datatype can be only FC_DT_INT or FC_DT_FLOAT or FC_DT_DOUBLE
03564   if (dim < 2 || mathtype != FC_MT_VECTOR || 
03565       !(datatype == FC_DT_INT || datatype == FC_DT_FLOAT || datatype == FC_DT_DOUBLE)) {
03566     fc_printfErrorMessage("Input Error: not a vector or bad datatype");
03567     return FC_ERROR;
03568   }  
03569 
03570   // log message
03571   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating new magnitude variable.");
03572 
03573   // get data
03574   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(var, &data);
03575   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03576     return rc; 
03577 
03578   // create the new data
03579   new_data = malloc(sizeof(double)*numData);
03580   if (new_data == NULL) {
03581     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03582     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03583   }
03584   for (i = 0; i < numData; i++) {
03585     new_data[i] = 0;
03586     for (j = 0; j < dim; j++) {
03587       switch(datatype) {
03588       case FC_DT_INT: 
03589      new_data[i] += ((int*)data)[i*dim+j] * ((int*)data)[i*dim+j];
03590      break;
03591       case FC_DT_FLOAT:
03592      new_data[i] += ((float*)data)[i*dim+j] * ((float*)data)[i*dim+j];
03593      break;
03594       case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
03595      new_data[i] += ((double*)data)[i*dim+j] * ((double*)data)[i*dim+j];
03596      break;
03597       default:
03598      ; // nothing
03599       }
03600     }
03601     new_data[i] = sqrt(new_data[i]);
03602   }
03603 
03604   // create the new variable
03605   if (fc_isVariableGlobal(var)) {
03606     FC_Dataset dataset;
03607     rc = fc_getDatasetFromVariable(var, &dataset);
03608     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03609       return rc;
03610     rc = fc_createGlobalVariable(dataset, new_var_name, new_var);
03611     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03612       return rc; 
03613   }
03614   else {
03615     FC_Mesh mesh;
03616     rc = fc_getMeshFromVariable(var, &mesh);
03617     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03618       return rc;
03619     rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, new_var_name, new_var);
03620     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03621       return rc; 
03622   }
03623  
03624   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*new_var, numData, 1, assoc, FC_MT_SCALAR, 
03625                     FC_DT_DOUBLE, (void*)new_data);
03626   // do not free new_data 
03627        
03628   return rc;    
03629 }       
03630 
03631 /**
03632  * \ingroup  VariableMath
03633  * \brief Decompose a vector into normal and tangent components respective
03634  *          to a reference vector.
03635  *
03636  * \description
03637  *  
03638  *    Most common usage will be to decompose a force on a surface into a
03639  *    component in the direction of the surface normal, and a component
03640  *    tangential to the surface.
03641  *
03642  *    Note, an infinite number of vectors are tangent to the reference
03643  *    vector. The calculated tangential component will be in the plane defined
03644  *    by the input vector and the reference vector. (Perhaps we should also
03645  *    calculate and return this?)
03646  *
03647  *    Note that the dimensions of the input and reference vector do not have to
03648  *    be equal. The extra dimensions are assumed to have component values of
03649  *    zero. (In fact, one of the vectors could be a scalar. This would
03650  *    correspond to a vector aligned with the X axis).
03651  *
03652  * \modifications  
03653  *   - 2003-MAY-15  W Koegler  Created.
03654  *   - 2003-SEP-05  W Koegler  Moved core of decompose algorithm to its own
03655  *   function _fc_decomposeVector to better share w/ others functions.
03656  *   - 11/01/04 WSK Moved from geom to varmath
03657  */
03658 FC_ReturnCode fc_createNormalTangentVariables(
03659   FC_Variable inputVector, /**< input - vector variable to decompose */
03660   int dim_ref,    /**< input - the number of components in reference vector */
03661   double* referenceVector, /**< input - the components of the reference vector */
03662   FC_Variable* normalComponent, /**< output - new variable with normal components */
03663   FC_Variable* tangentComponent /**< output - new variable with tangent components */
03664 ) {
03665   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03666   int i, j;
03667   int numData; // number of data points
03668   int dim_in; // number of components per point
03669   FC_AssociationType assoc;
03670   FC_DataType datatype;
03671   FC_MathType mathtype;
03672   double magnitude;
03673   double *normRefVect = NULL;
03674   double *normals = NULL, *tangents = NULL;
03675   void *datap = NULL;
03676   char *vname = NULL;
03677   char *tempstring1 = NULL, *tempstring2 = NULL;
03678   
03679   // set default return values
03680   if (normalComponent)
03681     *normalComponent = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03682   if (tangentComponent)
03683     *tangentComponent = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03684   
03685   // check input
03686   if (!fc_isVariableValid(inputVector) || dim_ref < 1 || !referenceVector ||
03687       !normalComponent || !tangentComponent)  {
03688     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03689     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03690   }
03691   
03692   // log message
03693   fc_printfLogMessage("Decomposing a vector into normal and tangent "
03694                       "components.");   
03695   
03696   // get info about inputVector
03697   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(inputVector, &numData, &dim_in, &assoc,  
03698                           &mathtype, &datatype);
03699   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03700     return rc;
03701   if (mathtype != FC_MT_SCALAR && mathtype != FC_MT_VECTOR)
03702     return FC_ERROR; // can't handle tensor
03703   
03704   // get input vector data
03705   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(inputVector, &datap);
03706   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03707     return rc;
03708   
03709   // calculate magnitude of reference vector
03710   magnitude = 0;
03711   for (i = 0; i < dim_ref; i++)
03712     magnitude += referenceVector[i]*referenceVector[i];
03713   magnitude = sqrt(magnitude);
03714   // FIX!
03715   if (magnitude <= 0)
03716     return FC_ERROR; 
03717   
03718   // make normalized reference vector
03719   normRefVect = malloc(sizeof(double)*dim_ref);
03720   if (normRefVect == NULL ) {
03721     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03722     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03723   } 
03724   if (magnitude > 0) {
03725     for (i = 0; i < dim_ref; i++)
03726       normRefVect[i] = referenceVector[i]/magnitude;
03727   }
03728   
03729   // make space for temporary normal and tangent component arrays
03730   normals = malloc(sizeof(double)*numData);
03731   tangents = malloc(sizeof(double)*numData);
03732   if (normals == NULL || tangents == NULL) {
03733     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03734     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03735   } 
03736   
03737   switch (datatype) {
03738   case FC_DT_INT: 
03739     {
03740       int *castp = (int*)datap;
03741       double temp[dim_in];
03742       for (i = 0; i < numData; i++) {
03743         for (j = 0; j < dim_in; j++)
03744           temp[j] = castp[i*dim_in + j];
03745         _fc_decomposeVector(dim_in, temp, dim_ref, normRefVect, &normals[i],
03746                             &tangents[i]);
03747       }
03748     } 
03749     break;
03750   case FC_DT_FLOAT: 
03751     {
03752       float *castp = (float*)datap;
03753       double temp[dim_in];
03754       for (i = 0; i < numData; i++) {
03755         for (j = 0; j < dim_in; j++)
03756           temp[j] = castp[i*dim_in + j];
03757         _fc_decomposeVector(dim_in, temp, dim_ref, normRefVect, &normals[i],
03758                             &tangents[i]);
03759       }
03760     } 
03761     break;
03762   case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
03763     {
03764       double *castp = (double*)datap;
03765       for (i = 0; i < numData; i++) 
03766         _fc_decomposeVector(dim_in, &castp[i*dim_in], dim_ref,
03767                             normRefVect, &normals[i], &tangents[i]);
03768     } 
03769     break;
03770   default:
03771     return FC_ERROR;
03772   }
03773   free(normRefVect);
03774   
03775   // add new variables to current mesh/dataset
03776   rc = fc_getVariableName(inputVector, &vname);
03777   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03778     return rc;
03779   tempstring1 = malloc(sizeof(char)*(strlen(vname) + 55));
03780   tempstring2 = malloc(sizeof(char)*(strlen(vname) + 55));
03781   if (tempstring1 == NULL || tempstring2 == NULL) {
03782     free(tempstring1);
03783     free(tempstring2);
03784     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03785     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03786   } 
03787   sprintf(tempstring1, "%s Normal Component decomposed on a reference vector",
03788           vname);
03789   sprintf(tempstring2, "%s Tangent Component decomposed on a reference vector",
03790           vname);
03791   free(vname);
03792   if (fc_isVariableGlobal(inputVector)) {
03793     FC_Dataset dataset;
03794     rc = fc_getDatasetFromVariable(inputVector, &dataset);
03795     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03796       return rc;
03797     rc = fc_createGlobalVariable(dataset, tempstring1, normalComponent);
03798     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03799       return rc;
03800     rc = fc_createGlobalVariable(dataset, tempstring2, tangentComponent);
03801     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03802       return rc;
03803   }
03804   else {
03805     FC_Mesh mesh;
03806     rc = fc_getMeshFromVariable(inputVector, &mesh);
03807     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03808       return rc;
03809     rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, tempstring1, normalComponent);
03810     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03811       return rc;
03812     rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, tempstring2, tangentComponent);
03813     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03814       return rc;
03815   }
03816   free(tempstring1);
03817   free(tempstring2);
03818   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*normalComponent, numData, 1, assoc, FC_MT_SCALAR, 
03819                              FC_DT_DOUBLE, normals);
03820   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03821     return rc;
03822   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*tangentComponent, numData, 1, assoc, FC_MT_SCALAR, 
03823                              FC_DT_DOUBLE, tangents);
03824   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03825     return rc;
03826   
03827   return FC_SUCCESS;
03828 }
03829 
03830 /**
03831  * \ingroup  VariableMath
03832  * \brief Decompose a vector into normal and tangent components respective
03833  *          to a reference vector.
03834  *
03835  * \description
03836  *  
03837  *    See fc_createNormalTangentVariables. This function is similar except
03838  *    that it takes a field of reference vectors instead of a
03839  *    single reference vector.
03840  *
03841  * \modifications  
03842  *   - 2003-MAY-15  W Koegler  Created.
03843  *   - 2003-SEP-05  W Koegler  Moved core of decompose algorithm to its own
03844  *   function _fc_decomposeVector to better share w/ others functions.
03845  *   - 11/01/04 WSK Moved from geom to varmath
03846  */
03847 FC_ReturnCode fc_createNormalTangentVariables2(
03848   FC_Variable inputVector,      /**< input - vector variable to decompose */
03849   FC_Variable referenceVector,  /**< input - variable of reference vectors */
03850   FC_Variable* normalComponent, /**< output - new variable with normal components */
03851   FC_Variable* tangentComponent /**< output - new variable with tangent components */
03852 ) {
03853   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03854   int i, j;
03855   int dim_in;  // number of components in input vector
03856   int dim_ref; // number of components in reference vector
03857   int numData_in, numData_ref;
03858   FC_AssociationType assoc_in, assoc_ref;
03859   FC_DataType datatype_in, datatype_ref;
03860   //FC_DataType datatype_min;
03861   FC_MathType mathtype_in, mathtype_ref;
03862   double *normRefVect = NULL;
03863   double *normals = NULL, *tangents = NULL;
03864   void *data_in = NULL, *data_ref;
03865   char *name_in = NULL, *name_ref = NULL;
03866   char *tempstring1 = NULL, *tempstring2 = NULL;
03867   
03868   // set default return values
03869   if (normalComponent)
03870     *normalComponent = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03871   if (tangentComponent)
03872     *tangentComponent = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03873   
03874   // check input
03875   if (!fc_isVariableValid(inputVector) || 
03876       !fc_isVariableValid(referenceVector) || !normalComponent || 
03877       !tangentComponent) {
03878     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03879     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03880   }
03881   
03882   // log message
03883   fc_printfLogMessage("Decomposing vector into a normal and tangent "
03884                       "components with respect to a reference vector.");
03885 
03886   // get info about inputVector
03887   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(inputVector, &numData_in, &dim_in, &assoc_in, 
03888                      &mathtype_in, &datatype_in);
03889   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03890     return rc;
03891   if (mathtype_in != FC_MT_SCALAR && mathtype_in != FC_MT_VECTOR) 
03892     return FC_ERROR; // can't handle tensors
03893   
03894   // get info about reference Vector
03895   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(referenceVector, &numData_ref, &dim_ref, &assoc_ref, 
03896                      &mathtype_ref, &datatype_ref);
03897   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03898     return rc;
03899   if (numData_in != numData_ref)
03900     return FC_ERROR; // Must have same number of data points
03901   if (mathtype_ref != FC_MT_SCALAR && mathtype_ref != FC_MT_VECTOR) 
03902     return FC_ERROR; // can't handle tensors
03903   
03904   // get vector data
03905   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(inputVector, &data_in);
03906   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03907     return rc;
03908   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(referenceVector, &data_ref);
03909   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03910     return rc;
03911   
03912   // normalize the reference vector
03913   // also converts to double
03914   normRefVect = malloc(sizeof(double)*numData_ref*dim_ref);
03915   if (normRefVect == NULL ) {
03916     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03917     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03918   } 
03919   switch (datatype_ref) {
03920   case FC_DT_INT:
03921     {
03922       int* castp = (int*)data_ref;
03923       for (i = 0; i < numData_in; i++) {
03924         for (j = 0; j < dim_ref; j++)
03925           normRefVect[i*dim_ref + j] = castp[i*dim_ref + j];
03926       }
03927     }
03928     break;
03929   case FC_DT_FLOAT:
03930     {
03931       float* castp = (float*)data_ref;
03932       for (i = 0; i < numData_in; i++) {
03933         for (j = 0; j < dim_ref; j++)
03934           normRefVect[i*dim_ref + j] = castp[i*dim_ref + j];
03935       }
03936     }
03937     break;
03938   case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
03939     {
03940       double* castp = (double*)data_ref;
03941       for (i = 0; i < numData_in; i++) {
03942         for (j = 0; j < dim_ref; j++)
03943           normRefVect[i*dim_ref + j] = castp[i*dim_ref + j];
03944       }
03945     }
03946     break;
03947   default:
03948     return FC_ERROR;
03949   }
03950   
03951   // make space for temporary normal and tangent component arrays
03952   normals = malloc(sizeof(double)*numData_in);
03953   tangents = malloc(sizeof(double)*numData_in);
03954   if (normals == NULL || tangents == NULL) {
03955     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03956     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03957   } 
03958   
03959   switch (datatype_in) {
03960   case FC_DT_INT: 
03961     {
03962       int *castp = (int*)data_in;
03963       double temp[dim_in];
03964       for (i = 0; i < numData_in; i++) {
03965         for (j = 0; j < dim_in; j++)
03966           temp[j] = castp[i*dim_in + j];
03967         _fc_decomposeVector(dim_in, temp, dim_ref, &normRefVect[i*dim_ref], 
03968                             &normals[i], &tangents[i]);
03969       }
03970     } 
03971     break;
03972   case FC_DT_FLOAT: 
03973     {
03974       float *castp = (float*)data_in;
03975       double temp[dim_in];
03976       for (i = 0; i < numData_in; i++) {
03977         for (j = 0; j < dim_in; j++)
03978           temp[j] = castp[i*dim_in + j];
03979         _fc_decomposeVector(dim_in, temp, dim_ref, &normRefVect[i*dim_ref], 
03980                             &normals[i], &tangents[i]);
03981       }
03982     } 
03983     break;
03984   case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
03985     {
03986       double *castp = (double*)data_in;
03987       for (i = 0; i < numData_in; i++) 
03988         _fc_decomposeVector(dim_in, &castp[i*dim_in], dim_ref,
03989                             &normRefVect[i*dim_ref], &normals[i], &tangents[i]);
03990     } 
03991     break;
03992   default:
03993     return FC_ERROR;
03994   }
03995   free(normRefVect);
03996   
03997   // add new variables to current mesh
03998   // FIX check for name collisions, better if done in create_variable
03999   rc = fc_getVariableName(inputVector, &name_in);
04000   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04001     return rc;
04002   rc = fc_getVariableName(referenceVector, &name_ref);
04003   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04004     return rc;
04005   tempstring1 = malloc(sizeof(char)*(strlen(name_in) + strlen(name_ref) +40));
04006   tempstring2 = malloc(sizeof(char)*(strlen(name_in) + strlen(name_ref) +40));
04007   if (tempstring1 == NULL || tempstring2 == NULL) {
04008     free(tempstring1);
04009     free(tempstring2);
04010     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04011     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04012   }
04013   sprintf(tempstring1, "%s Normal Component with respect to %s", name_in, name_ref);
04014   sprintf(tempstring2, "%s Tangent Component with respect to %s", name_in, name_ref);
04015   free(name_in);
04016   free(name_ref);
04017   if (fc_isVariableGlobal(inputVector)) {
04018     FC_Dataset dataset;
04019     rc = fc_getDatasetFromVariable(inputVector, &dataset);
04020     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04021       return rc;
04022     rc = fc_createGlobalVariable(dataset, tempstring1, normalComponent);
04023     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04024       return rc;
04025     rc = fc_createGlobalVariable(dataset, tempstring2, tangentComponent);
04026     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04027       return rc;
04028   }
04029   else {
04030     FC_Mesh mesh;
04031     rc = fc_getMeshFromVariable(inputVector, &mesh);
04032     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04033       return rc;
04034     rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, tempstring1, normalComponent);
04035     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04036       return rc;
04037     rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, tempstring2, tangentComponent);
04038     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04039       return rc;
04040   }
04041   free(tempstring1);
04042   free(tempstring2);
04043   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*normalComponent, numData_in, 1, assoc_in, 
04044                         FC_MT_SCALAR, FC_DT_DOUBLE, normals);
04045   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04046     return rc;
04047   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*tangentComponent, numData_in, 1, assoc_in, 
04048                         FC_MT_SCALAR, FC_DT_DOUBLE, tangents);
04049   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04050     return rc;
04051   
04052   return FC_SUCCESS;
04053 }
04054 
04055 /**
04056  * \ingroup VariableMath
04057  * \brief Compute Von Mises stress and pressure from the stress matrix.
04058  *
04059  * \description
04060  *
04061  *    Given the six variables that make up the symmetric stress tensor,
04062  *    this function computes the Von Mises stress and the pressure.
04063  *    The expected order of the stress tensor components (passed in as
04064  *    an array) are { xx, yy, zz, xy, yz, zx };
04065  *
04066  *    The calculations are based on equations from "Intermediate Mechanics
04067  *    of Materials", J. R. Barber, McGraw-Hill, 2001, pgs 33-48. Pressure
04068  *    is defined such that it is negative for compression and positive
04069  *    for tension.
04070  *
04071  * \todo Is this the best home for this function?
04072  *
04073  * \todo this doesn't handle global vars yet
04074  *
04075  * \modifications
04076  *    - 8/08/2006 WSD Created.
04077  */
04078 FC_ReturnCode fc_createStressPressureVariables(
04079   FC_Variable* sigmaVars, /**< input - array of 6 stress tensor components
04080                   in order { xx, yy, zz, xy, yz, zx } */
04081   FC_Variable* stressVar,   /**< output - the von misses stress */
04082   FC_Variable* pressureVar  /**< output - the pressure */
04083 ) 
04084 {
04085   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04086   int i;
04087   // sigmas: 0 - xx, 1 - yy, 2 - zz, 3 - xy , 4 - yz, 5 - zx
04088   double* sigmas[6];
04089   double* stress;
04090   double* pressure;
04091   int numDataPoint;
04092   FC_Mesh mesh;
04093   FC_AssociationType assoc;
04094 
04095   // default return
04096   if (stressVar)
04097     *stressVar = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
04098   if (pressureVar)
04099     *pressureVar = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
04100 
04101   // check input 
04102   if (!sigmaVars || !stressVar || !pressureVar) {
04103     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04104     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04105   }
04106   for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
04107     int numComp;
04108     FC_Mesh temp_mesh;
04109     if (!fc_isVariableValid(sigmaVars[i])) {
04110       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04111       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04112     }
04113     fc_getVariableNumComponent(sigmaVars[i], &numComp);
04114     if (numComp != 1) {
04115       fc_printfErrorMessage("input stress components must be scalars");
04116       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04117     }
04118     fc_getMeshFromVariable(sigmaVars[i], &temp_mesh);
04119     if (i == 0)
04120       mesh = temp_mesh;
04121     else if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, temp_mesh)) {
04122       fc_printfErrorMessage("all stress components must be on same mesh");
04123       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04124     }
04125   }
04126 
04127   // log messaeg
04128   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating Von Misses stress and pressure variables");
04129 
04130   // get the starting data
04131   rc = fc_getMeshFromVariable(sigmaVars[0], &mesh);
04132   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04133     return rc;
04134   rc = fc_getVariableAssociationType(sigmaVars[0], &assoc);
04135   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04136     return rc;
04137   rc = fc_getVariableNumDataPoint(sigmaVars[0], &numDataPoint);
04138   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04139     return rc;
04140   for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
04141     rc = fc_getVariableDataAsDataType(sigmaVars[i], FC_DT_DOUBLE, 
04142                           (void*)&sigmas[i]);
04143     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04144       return rc;
04145   }
04146 
04147   // make room for new data
04148   stress = (double*)malloc(numDataPoint*sizeof(double));
04149   pressure = (double*)malloc(numDataPoint*sizeof(double));
04150   if (!stress || !pressure) {
04151     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04152     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04153   }
04154 
04155   // calculate data
04156   for (i = 0; i < numDataPoint; i++) {
04157     double I1, I2, I3;
04158     double phi;
04159     
04160     I1 = sigmas[0][i] + sigmas[1][i] + sigmas[2][i];
04161     I2 =   sigmas[0][i]*sigmas[1][i]
04162          + sigmas[1][i]*sigmas[2][i]
04163          + sigmas[2][i]*sigmas[0][i] 
04164          - sigmas[3][i]*sigmas[3][i] 
04165          - sigmas[4][i]*sigmas[4][i]
04166          - sigmas[5][i]*sigmas[5][i];
04167     I3 =   sigmas[0][i]*sigmas[1][i]*sigmas[2][i]
04168          - sigmas[0][i]*sigmas[4][i]*sigmas[4][i]
04169          - sigmas[1][i]*sigmas[5][i]*sigmas[5][i]
04170          - sigmas[2][i]*sigmas[3][i]*sigmas[3][i]
04171          + 2*sigmas[3][i]*sigmas[4][i]*sigmas[5][i];
04172 
04173     stress[i] = sqrt(I1*I1 - 3*I2);
04174 
04175     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(stress[i], 0)) {
04176       pressure[i] = 1/3. * I1;
04177     }
04178     else {
04179       phi = 1/3. * acos((2*I1*I1*I1 - 9*I1*I2 + 27*I3)/2./
04180                (stress[i]*stress[i]*stress[i]));      
04181       pressure[i] = 1/3. * (I1 + 2.*stress[i]*(cos(phi) +
04182                                 cos(phi + 2./3.*FC_PI) + 
04183                                 cos(phi + 4./3.*FC_PI)));
04184     }
04185   }
04186   for (i = 0; i < 6; i++)
04187     free(sigmas[i]);
04188 
04189   // create new vars
04190   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "von mises stress", stressVar);
04191   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04192     return rc;
04193   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*stressVar, numDataPoint, 1, assoc,
04194                     FC_MT_SCALAR, FC_DT_DOUBLE, stress);
04195   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04196     return rc;
04197   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "pressure", pressureVar);
04198   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04199     return rc;
04200   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*pressureVar, numDataPoint, 1, assoc,
04201                     FC_MT_SCALAR, FC_DT_DOUBLE, pressure);
04202   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04203     return rc;
04204 
04205   return FC_SUCCESS;
04206 }
04207 
04208 //@}
04209 
04210 /**
04211  * \ingroup  PrivateVariableMath
04212  * \brief Decompose a vector into normal and tangent components respective
04213  *          to a reference vector.
04214  *
04215  * \description
04216  *  
04217  *    Most common usage will be to decompose a force on a surface into a
04218  *    component in the direction of the surface normal, and a component
04219  *    tangential to the surface.
04220  *
04221  *    Note, an infinite number of vectors are tangent to the reference
04222  *    vector. The calculated tangential component will be in the plane defined
04223  *    by the input vector and the reference vector. (Perhaps we should also
04224  *    calculate and return this?)
04225  *
04226  *    Note, the dimensions of the input and reference vector do not have to be
04227  *    equal. The extra dimensions are assumed to have component values of
04228  *    zero. (In fact, one of the vectors could be a scalar. This would
04229  *    correspond to a vector aligned with the X axis).
04230  *
04231  * \modifications  
04232  *    - 2003-SEP-05  W Koegler  Created by moving code from fc_decomposeVector
04233  *    - 11/01/04 WSK Moved from geom to varmath
04234  */
04235 void _fc_decomposeVector(
04236   int dim_in,    /**< input - the number of components in the input vector */
04237   double* inputVector, /**< input - the vector to be decomposed */
04238   int dim_ref,   /**< input - the number of components in the reference vector */
04239   double* referenceVector, /**< input - the components of the reference vector */
04240   double* normalComponent, /**< output - the normal component */
04241   double* tangentComponent /**< output - the tangent component */
04242 ) {
04243   int i;
04244   int dim_min;
04245   double inMagnitude_sq;            // squared magnitude of input vector (^2)
04246   double refMagnitude;              // magnitude of reference vector
04247   double normalizedRefVec[dim_ref]; // normalized reference vector
04248   double* refVector_p;              // pointer to the reference vector
04249   double normal, tangent;
04250   
04251   // default output values  
04252   *normalComponent = 0.;
04253   *tangentComponent = 0.;
04254   
04255   // log message
04256   fc_printfLogMessage("Decomposing vector.");  
04257   
04258   // calculate magnitudes of the vectors & return if they are zero
04259   inMagnitude_sq = 0;
04260   for (i = 0; i < dim_in; i++)
04261     inMagnitude_sq += inputVector[i]*inputVector[i];
04262   if (sqrt(inMagnitude_sq) < DBL_MIN)
04263     return;
04264   refMagnitude = 0;
04265   for (i = 0; i < dim_ref; i++)
04266     refMagnitude += referenceVector[i]*referenceVector[i];
04267   refMagnitude = sqrt(refMagnitude);
04268   if (refMagnitude < DBL_MIN)
04269     return;
04270   
04271   // if necessary, normalize the reference vector
04272   if (!FC_DBL_EQUIV(refMagnitude, 1.)) {
04273     for (i = 0; i < dim_ref; i++)
04274       normalizedRefVec[i] = referenceVector[i]/refMagnitude;
04275     refVector_p = normalizedRefVec;
04276   }
04277   else
04278     refVector_p = referenceVector;
04279   
04280   // calculate Normal Component, use smaller of dims
04281   // Fn = F dot N = SUM(fi*ni)   
04282   dim_min = dim_in < dim_ref ? dim_in : dim_ref;
04283   normal = 0;
04284   for (i = 0; i < dim_min; i++)
04285     normal += inputVector[i]*refVector_p[i];
04286   
04287   // calculate tangent component, use
04288   // Ft = SQRT(|F|^2 - Fn^2) = SQRT( SUM(fi^2) - Fn^2 )
04289   tangent = inMagnitude_sq - normal*normal;
04290   if (FC_VALUE_EQUIV(inMagnitude_sq, normal*normal, 4*DBL_EPSILON, DBL_MIN))
04291     tangent = 0.;
04292   else
04293     tangent = sqrt(tangent);
04294   
04295   *normalComponent = normal;
04296   *tangentComponent = tangent;
04297 }
